name: Portfolio
description: Portfolio website built using React. The main goal was to create a single-page portfolio site that showcases my front-end design skills
tooltip: JS with React. No CSS library used

name: Disaster Display Frontend
description: Front-end application built using Next.js and Leaflet to show disasters dynamically
tooltip: Next.js framework consuming back-end API (see disaster display backend). Note: now data is bundled locally

name: Disaster Display Backend
description: Back-end application that fetches and processes disaster data from various sources using Django to provide a RESTful API
tooltip: Python using Django. Note: no longer running due to costs, previously deployed on Amazon EC2

name: Charity Walking App
description: A webapp built to add your distance walked, with intelligent unit conversion, along with leaderboards and charts that are created dynamically.
tooltip: PHP-based web app to work on the LAMP stack. Charts provided using Charts.js

name: Feudalia Plugin Suite
description: Suite of plugins built using the Spigot/Bukkit API in Java that heavily change the core multiplayer gameplay loop. Provides Character cards and Chat functionality
tooltip: Java involving Bukkit/Spigot API, Discord API, and various Minecraft plugin APIs. Project building using Maven

name: COVID Alarm
description: This project was written in Python/Flask. It allows the user to schedule alarms for updates on news and weather, as well as sending the user automatic notifications
tooltip: Python using Flask, uk-covid-19, and various other libraries. Consuming RESTful API of OpenWeatherMap and NewsAPI

name: Covid Map
description: Full-stack application that allows authenticated users to plot an infection on a map
tooltip: HTML, CSS, PHP, and MySQL used to enable full-stack functionality
